Description:
The session will detail resources available to researchers from the Frederick National Laboratory for Cancer Research (FLNCR) and a new initiative for drug discovery, the NCI Program for Natural Product Discovery (NPNPD). 
The Frederick National Laboratory for Cancer Research, sponsored by the National Cancer Institute, is a national resource for cancer researchers with one-of-a kind services and tools for extramural use. The lab’s biomedical technologies and repositories are available for free or at-cost, for government, academic and industry investigators to facilitate their own important research. The presentation will discuss the variety of opportunities for investigators to partner with the laboratory, and how to access technical services including assays, cell lines, and other products for HIV, cancer, and biomedical research. 
 The NPNPD is a Cancer Moonshot funded program designed to greatly increase the efficiency of natural products chemistry and empower researchers to engage in the discovery of anticancer agents from natural product sources. The NPNPD has developed an automated, high-throughput robotics platform which is generating a library of >1,000,000 partially purified natural product fractions for screening. Both the plated fraction library and automated secondary purification and structure elucidation capabilities have been created and are being provided to cancer researchers at no cost.

Title: NCI Resource: The Frederick National Laboratory for Cancer Research and the NCI Program for Natural Product Discovery
